function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of consideration for spatial autocorrelation in disease spread analysis","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of disease transmission patterns, leading to ineffective control measures","Mitigation":"Incorporate spatial autocorrelation techniques like LISA and GWR to account for spatial dependence","Technologies":"LISA, GWR model","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, urban planners","Owner":"Epidemiologists, statisticians, data analysts"},{"Description":"Misinterpretation of global and local effects in the mixed GWR model","Impact":"Incorrect estimation of the influence of explanatory variables on disease spread, leading to misguided interventions","Mitigation":"Thorough understanding and careful interpretation of the global and local effects in the mixed GWR model","Technologies":"Mixed GWR model, statistical analysis tools","People":"Data analysts, statisticians, epidemiologists","Owner":"Statisticians, data analysts, epidemiologists"},{"Description":"Assumption of spatial stationarity in explanatory variables in the MLR model","Impact":"Inaccurate modeling of disease transmission dynamics, resulting in flawed policy recommendations","Mitigation":"Validate the spatial stationarity of explanatory variables and consider spatially varying effects","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, MLR model","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, urban planners","Owner":"Epidemiologists, statisticians, data analysts"}]}
